results.title: The Effect of Statins on Ocular Disorders: A Systematic Review of Randomized Controlled Trials
results.text_hl: Ten studies investigated the role of @<m>CHEMICAL_Simvastatin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D019821 @@@simvastatin@@@, suggesting a lack of cataractogenic effect and a possible protective role in @<m>DISEASE_Cataract</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D002386 @@@cataract@@@ formation, @DISEASE_Retinal_Diseases @DISEASE_MESH:D012164 @@@retinal vascular diseases@@@, and especially @DISEASE_Diabetic_Retinopathy @DISEASE_MESH:D003930 @@@diabetic retinopathy@@@, @DISEASE_Macular_Degeneration @DISEASE_MESH:D008268 @@@age-related macular disease@@@ progression, and non-infectious @DISEASE_Uveitis @DISEASE_MESH:D014605 @@@uveitis@@@.

citations.NLM: Lymperopoulou C, Kandarakis SA, Tzanaki I, Mylona I, Xanthos T, Agouridis AP. The Effect of Statins on Ocular Disorders: A Systematic Review of Randomized Controlled Trials Pharmaceuticals (Basel). 2023 May 7;16(5):. PMID: 37242493
citations.BibTeX: @article{37242493, title={The Effect of Statins on Ocular Disorders: A Systematic Review of Randomized Controlled Trials}, author={Lymperopoulou C and Kandarakis SA and Tzanaki I and Mylona I and Xanthos T and Agouridis AP}, journal={Pharmaceuticals (Basel)}, volume={16}, number={5}}

results.title: Simvastatin alleviates epithelial-mesenchymal transition and oxidative stress of high glucose-induced lens epithelial cells in vitro by inhibiting RhoA/ROCK signaling
results.text_hl: The aim of the present study was to examine the effect of @<m>CHEMICAL_Simvastatin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D019821 @@@simvastatin@@@ on lens epithelial cells in @<m>DISEASE_Cataract</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D002386 @@@DC@@@ and the underlying mechanism.

citations.NLM: Fu J, Hu X. Simvastatin alleviates epithelial-mesenchymal transition and oxidative stress of high glucose-induced lens epithelial cells in vitro by inhibiting RhoA/ROCK signaling Exp Ther Med. 2022 Jun;23(6):420. PMID: 35601076

results.title: Long-term safety and efficacy profile of simvastatin.
results.text_hl: Long-term safety and efficacy profile of @<m>CHEMICAL_Simvastatin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D019821 @@@simvastatin@@@.

results.title: Risk of cataract in patients treated with statins.
results.text_hl: CONCLUSIONS: Our study provides evidence that long-term use of therapeutic statin doses does not increase the risk of developing @<m>DISEASE_Cataract</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D002386 @@@cataract@@@. Concomitant use of @CHEMICAL_Erythromycin @CHEMICAL_MESH:D004917 @@@erythromycin@@@ and @<m>CHEMICAL_Simvastatin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D019821 @@@simvastatin@@@ may increase the @<m>DISEASE_Cataract</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D002386 @@@cataract@@@ risk.

citations.NLM: Schlienger RG, Haefeli WE, Jick H, Meier CR. Risk of cataract in patients treated with statins. Arch Intern Med. 2001 Sep 10;161(16):2021-6. PMID: 11525705
citations.BibTeX: @article{11525705, title={Risk of cataract in patients treated with statins.}, author={Schlienger RG and Haefeli WE and Jick H and Meier CR}, journal={Arch Intern Med}, volume={161}, number={16}, pages={2021-6}}

results.title: Lens changes in matched normals and hyperlipidemic patients treated with simvastatin for 2 years.
results.text_hl: ...@<m>CHEMICAL_Simvastatin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D019821 @@@Simvastatin@@@, a potent blood lipid reducer, has been suspected of inducing @<m>DISEASE_Cataract</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D002386 @@@cataract@@@ in @SPECIES_9615 @@@dogs@@@.

citations.NLM: Lundh BL, Nilsson SE. Lens changes in matched normals and hyperlipidemic patients treated with simvastatin for 2 years. Acta Ophthalmol (Copenh). 1990 Dec;68(6):658-60. PMID: 2080693

results.title: Animal safety and toxicology of simvastatin and related hydroxy-methylglutaryl-coenzyme A reductase inhibitors.
results.text_hl: The data suggest that the development of @<m>DISEASE_Cataract</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D002386 @@@lenticular opacities@@@ at clinical doses of @<m>CHEMICAL_Simvastatin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D019821 @@@simvastatin@@@ is highly improbable.

citations.NLM: Gerson RJ, MacDonald JS, Alberts AW, Kornbrust DJ, Majka JA, Stubbs RJ, Bokelman DL. Animal safety and toxicology of simvastatin and related hydroxy-methylglutaryl-coenzyme A reductase inhibitors. Am J Med. 1989 Oct 16;87(4A):28S-38S. PMID: 2679082

results.title: Discordant expression of the sterol pathway in lens underlies simvastatin-induced cataracts in Chbb: Thom rats.
results.text_hl: Discordant expression of the @CHEMICAL_Sterols @CHEMICAL_MESH:D013261 @@@sterol@@@ pathway in lens underlies @<m>CHEMICAL_Simvastatin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D019821 @@@simvastatin@@@-induced @<m>DISEASE_Cataract</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D002386 @@@cataracts@@@ in Chbb: Thom @SPECIES_10116 @@@rats@@@.

results.title: Effect of Randomized Lipid Lowering With Simvastatin and Ezetimibe on Cataract Development (from the Simvastatin and Ezetimibe in Aortic Stenosis Study).
results.text_hl: In conclusion, randomized treatment with @<m>CHEMICAL_Simvastatin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D019821 @@@simvastatin@@@ plus @CHEMICAL_Ezetimibe @CHEMICAL_MESH:D000069438 @@@ezetimibe@@@ was associated with a 44% lower risk of incident @<m>DISEASE_Cataract</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D002386 @@@cataract@@@ development.

citations.NLM: Bang CN, Greve AM, La Cour M, Boman K, Gohlke-Bärwolf C, Ray S, Pedersen T, Rossebø A, Okin PM, Devereux RB, Wachtell K. Effect of Randomized Lipid Lowering With Simvastatin and Ezetimibe on Cataract Development (from the Simvastatin and Ezetimibe in Aortic Stenosis Study). Am J Cardiol. 2015 Dec 15;116(12):1840-4. PMID: 26602073

results.title: Concentration and distribution of ubiquinone (coenzyme Q), the endogenous lipid antioxidant, in the rat lens: effect of treatment with simvastatin.
results.text_hl: Sprague-Dawley (SD) and Chbb:Thom (CT) @SPECIES_10116 @@@rats@@@ were treated with @<m>CHEMICAL_Simvastatin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D019821 @@@simvastatin@@@, an inducer of @<m>DISEASE_Cataract</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D002386 @@@cataracts@@@ in CT @SPECIES_10116 @@@rats@@@, to determine its effects on lens Ubs.

citations.NLM: Cenedella RJ, Neely AR, Sexton P. Concentration and distribution of ubiquinone (coenzyme Q), the endogenous lipid antioxidant, in the rat lens: effect of treatment with simvastatin. Mol Vis. 2005 Aug 10;11():594-602. PMID: 16110301
